snippet: Some small video game makers say the line between inspiration and shameless copying seems to have all but disappeared.
abstract: Some small video game makers say the line between inspiration and shameless copying seems to have all but disappeared; some larger app makers and online gaming developers like Zynga are cloning smaller game makers' creations; developers say they have little recourse for their stolen ideas, since the mechanics of a game cannot be copyrighted.

headline.main: For Creators of Games, a Faint Line on Cloning
headline.print_headline: For Creators Of Games, A Faint Line On Cloning

snippet: A video on YouTube has raised awareness about the Ugandan warlord Joseph Kony — and spurred a wave of criticism from pundits about the often simplistic nature of online activism.
abstract: Noam Cohen Link by Link column; charity Invisible Children has put out YouTube video Kony 2012 about Ugandan warlord Joseph Kony and his Lord's Resistance Army, pitched to a 5-year-old's sense of right and wrong; video has raised awareness, but also sparked criticism about the often simplistic nature of online activism.

headline.main: A Video Campaign and the Power of Simplicity
headline.print_headline: A Video Campaign and the Power of Simplicity

snippet: Feral pigs, known as eating machines in the South and West, are now troubling farms in New York’s Champlain Valley, devouring crops and prey.
abstract: Feral pigs have invaded upstate farms in New York’s Champlain Valley, devouring crops and prey; growing population's origin is generally unknown, although many theories exist; state officials, wildlife managers and researchers are exploring various control measures, from contraceptives to poisons and traps, as well as relaxing hunting rules for the swine.

headline.main: Wily, Elusive Foragers Invade Upstate New York
headline.print_headline: Wily, Elusive Foragers Invade Upstate New York

snippet: Why is it that TV manufacturers seem like they’ve given up making the next best thing since sliced bread and are just making the bread slices thinner?
abstract: Why is it that TV manufacturers seem like they’ve given up making the next best thing since sliced bread and are just making the bread slices thinner?

headline.main: Disruptions: TV Makers Ignore Apps at Their Own Peril
headline.print_headline: Disruptions: TV Makers Ignore Apps At Their Own Peril

snippet: Louisville withstood a closing run by Cincinnati for a victory Saturday night that gave the Cardinals their second Big East tournament championship.
abstract: Louisville defeats Cincinnati, 50-44, to win the men's college basketball Big East championship.

headline.main: Louisville Wins Title in Bittersweet Glimpse of Big East’s Future
headline.print_headline: Louisville Turns Back Cincinnati’s Late Run And Rules the Big East

snippet: Alain’s Bistro in Nyack stands out from its less attractive surroundings near the Tappan Zee Bridge, and the host is a charmer.
abstract: Emily DeNitto reviews Alain's Bistro in Nyack (Metropolitan/Westchester).

headline.main: A True Bistro, and a Destination
headline.print_headline: A True Bistro, And a Destination

snippet: SAN FRANCISCO -- Every night, I get home from work, drop onto the couch and sit there surfing the Web or watching videos on my 3 1/2-inch iPhone screen. My big-screen HDTV sits powered off on the other side of the room.     It isn't broken, either...
abstract: Nick Bilton Disruptions column; television makers must embrace changing habits of consumers if they expect to survive; competition with smartphones, computer and tablets is forcing manufacturers to think differently about the traditional television set and how it can be brought into the future, or risk real competition from Apple when it fully develops its Apple TV. (M)

headline.main: Disruptions: TV Makers Ignore Apps At Their Own Peril

snippet: About an hour after Apple said that its third-generation iPad would be available on AT&T and Verizon Wireless's 4G Long Term Evolution (LTE) networks, AT&T's press relations department e-mailed a statement claiming that it had the largest 4G netwo...
abstract: Bits blog; AT&T's statement that is has the largest 4G network in the nation, made after Apple said that its new iPad would be available on AT&T and Verizon Wireless's faster networks, is misleading; its 4G LTE network is not the same that is being highlighted for the device. (M)

headline.main: AT&T's Boast About Using 4G Seems a Stretch
